intro: Physosiphon ochraceus, commonly known as the yellow star moss, is a small, terrestrial liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It has a distinctive appearance with bright yellow to orange rhizoids and a dense, star-like growth pattern. The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having specialized structures called thallus. It reproduces through spores released from leaf-like structures called gametophores. Physosiphon ochraceus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for other small organisms.
